content.description:
Urbs tamen infelix, quam sors supremasupremus, -a, -um, adj.: final manebatmaneo, -ere: to await,
ingenti demumdemum, adv.: finally terrae concussaconcutio, -ere, concussi, concussum: to shake tremore
tota labatlabo, -are: to crumble.
content.question: In the sentence, what does quam mean?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
